DataElement.preferredName: Surgical Procedure Re-excision First Cancer Progression Performed Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the date a surgical procedure to remove the remaining abnormal tissues from the body, not completely removed in an earlier attempt following the initial increase in the size of a tumor or spread of cancer in the body was performed.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Surgical Procedure Re-excision First Cancer Progression Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a surgical procedure to remove the remaining abnormal tissues from the body, not completely removed in an earlier attempt following the initial increase in the size of a tumor or spread of cancer in the body.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Used for operative procedures on organs, regions, or tissues in the treatment of diseases, including tissue section by lasers. It excludes transplantation, for which "transplantation" is used.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

Property.preferredDefinition: A surgical procedure to remove the remaining abnormal tissues from the body, not completely removed in an earlier attempt.:Preceding all others in time or space or degree.:The worsening of a cancer over time.:Performed; carried out.

Concepts.definition: A surgical procedure to remove the remaining abnormal tissues from the body, not completely removed in an earlier attempt.
Preceding all others in time or space or degree.
A pathologic process in which alterations at the molecular level result in a more aggressive cytologic and phenotypic profile and clinical course of a malignant neoplasm.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The date on which an observation was made or an event occurred.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/3/17 tt added Diagnosis CSI. 6/20/17 jk transferred to NCI Standards per confirmation by Brian Campbell as part of Round 5 finalization task, added reg status.

DataElement.origin: NCCTG CRF:North Central Cancer Treatment Group Case Report Form
